ADOBE_PHOTOSHOP.TITLE: Adobe Photoshop
ADOBE_PHOTOSHOP.SUBTITLE: Design
ADOBE_PHOTOSHOP.DESCRIPTION: Adobe Photoshop is a raster graphics editor developed and published by Adobe Inc. for Windows and macOS. It is widely used by graphic designers, photographers, and artists to edit images, retouch photos, create digital art, and more. Photoshop is known for its wide range of tools and capabilities, including photo manipulation, color correction, digital painting, graphic design, and more. It is also part of Adobe Creative Cloud, allowing seamless integration with other Adobe applications.

ADOBE_ILLUSTRATOR.TITLE: Adobe Illustrator
ADOBE_ILLUSTRATOR.SUBTITLE: Design
ADOBE_ILLUSTRATOR.DESCRIPTION: Adobe Illustrator is a vector graphics editor and design program developed and marketed by Adobe Inc. It is widely used by graphic designers and artists to create and edit vector graphics. Unlike raster images, vector graphics can be scaled to any size without losing quality. Illustrator is known for its powerful drawing and tracing tools, its ability to create logos and typography, and its integration with other Adobe applications.

ADOBE_INDESIGN.TITLE: Adobe Indesign
ADOBE_INDESIGN.SUBTITLE: Design
ADOBE_INDESIGN.DESCRIPTION: InDesign is a software from Adobe that is primarily used for the design of publications and marketing materials. It allows users to create page layouts for print or digital distribution with a wealth of tools and features. Users can design brochures, magazines, books, posters, and more, with full control over typography, color, images, objects, and everything else that goes into a page layout. InDesign also integrates with other Adobe applications, allowing for a smoother workflow between programs.

ADOBE_XD.TITLE: Adobe XD
ADOBE_XD.SUBTITLE: Design
ADOBE_XD.DESCRIPTION: Adobe XD is a vector-based user experience design tool for web and mobile applications developed and published by Adobe Inc. It allows designers to create wireframes, interactive prototypes, and design mockups. Adobe XD also facilitates collaboration across teams, allowing multiple users to work on the same project at the same time. It is part of Adobe Creative Cloud, allowing seamless integration with other Adobe applications.
